intro: Pimelea curviflora var. micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved waratah, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a member of the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit and bright red or orange flowers. The leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
